item.title: Reimagining software delivery with AI-powered workflows in Jira & Bitbucket
item.description: üöÄ Exciting advancements in software delivery are here! The article discusses Rovo Dev, an AI agent that integrates with Jira and Bitbucket to enhance the software development lifecycle. It addresses common complexities developers face, such as managing vulnerabilities and tech debt. With Rovo Dev, routine tasks like code generation and pull requests become streamlined, allowing teams to focus on building quality software. The integration helps reduce friction and improves team efficiency….

item.title: 6 ways to prevent AI fatigue
item.description: AI is revolutionizing our work, but it can also lead to AI fatigue. This occurs when we feel overwhelmed by the rapid changes and demands of using various AI tools. Instead of avoiding AI, we should focus on intentional collaboration with it. By questioning how we use AI, we can prevent it from dictating our priorities. Atlassian shares six dos and don‚Äôts to reset our relationship with AI, helping us turn fatigue into creativity. For example, treat AI as a sparring partner rather than a…

item.title: Upgrades to Pipelines Artifacts: New Artifact Types & Selective Download
item.description: üöÄ Exciting enhancements to Bitbucket Pipelines artifacts are here! New artifact types include shared (accessible across steps) and scoped (specific to each step). This allows for better organization and management of your pipeline artifacts. Additionally, the selective download feature lets you specify which artifacts to download, saving time and build minutes. Explore these new functionalities for improved workflow efficiency! #Bitbucket #Pipelines #DevOps #SoftwareDevelopment…

item.title: An ‚Äúunreasonable‚Äù era: Mike Cannon-Brookes on leading, creating, and staying ambitious in the age of AI
item.description: üöÄ In a recent interview on the 20VC podcast, Mike Cannon-Brookes shared insights on leading in the age of AI. He advocates for a mindset of ‚Äúconstructive unreasonableness,‚Äù challenging the status quo to simplify complex systems. üí° He emphasizes the importance of psychological safety within teams, allowing for bold experimentation and quick pivots based on customer feedback. Atlassian focuses on integrating the best AI models to enhance customer value rather than creating their own. üîç This…

item.title: Building with Forge: Recap from the Atlassian Builders‚Äô Summit
item.description: üìÖ Last month, around 150 Atlassian practitioners gathered at the Atlassian Builders‚Äô Summit to explore Forge. The event featured presentations, hands-on workshops, and expert sessions aimed at empowering both admins and non-developers to build impactful apps and enhance security. Key sessions included a keynote by Matt Doar on the relevance of Forge, and practical workshops led by Liz Tanner and Darryl Lee, focusing on app development for non-developers. Tanya Botta concluded with insights on…

item.title: Reimagining how you structure workflows in Bitbucket Pipelines
item.description: üöÄ Exciting updates in Bitbucket Pipelines! Managing CI/CD workflows is now streamlined with the introduction of triggers. These allow teams to automate builds, tests, and deployments based on specific events and conditions. With the new top-level triggers property, users can define event-driven rules that separate pipeline definitions from their executions. üîç You can now use logical expressions and glob patterns for precise control over conditions. Plus, all matching pipelines will…

item.title: Why AI feels hard: We may need a new lens
item.description: Developers are navigating challenges with AI as they often view it merely as an advanced autocomplete tool. ü§ñ The real issue lies in the need for individual contributors (ICs) to adopt tech lead skills earlier in their careers. This shift requires them to think beyond just coding and focus on problem-solving and effective communication. üîÑ By understanding AI as a team member that requires clear direction, ICs can achieve better results and enhance their technical management skills. #AI…

item.title: Atlassian Rovo Dev Research: What Types of Code Review Comments Do Developers Most Frequently Resolve?
item.description: üöÄ Atlassian’s Rovo Dev research highlights how LLM-powered code reviews can enhance software quality. Rovo Dev identifies 2.8√ó more bugs and 1.4√ó more maintainability issues than human reviewers. It focuses on actionable comments to improve readability, bugs, and maintainability, making the review process faster. The study categorizes review comments into four main types: readability, bugs, maintainability, and design, alongside general discussions. This research was presented at ASE 2025 and…

item.title: Laura Burkhauser on helping teams rewire for AI
item.description: üöÄ Laura Burkhauser shares insights on AI adoption from her experience leading the product team at Descript. She describes a tech acceptance scale that moves from hostile to rewired. üîç Teams often have mixed reactions to AI, from skepticism to full integration. Laura emphasizes the importance of guiding teams through these stages. üåä She advocates for focusing on excitement rather than fear in AI adoption. Finding your “beach moment” can inspire teams to embrace change. #AIAdoption…

item.title: Migrating the Jira and Confluence applications to AWS Graviton
item.description: üöÄ Atlassian successfully migrated over 3,000 Jira and Confluence instances to AWS Graviton, enhancing performance and efficiency. The transition aimed to leverage both speed and cost-effectiveness, addressing challenges encountered during previous attempts. The move involved strategic planning to ensure minimal user impact while tackling complexities on a large scale. #AWSGraviton #Atlassian #CloudMigration #Jira #Confluence

item.title: Extended Timelines for Marketplace Revenue Share Changes
item.description: üöÄ Atlassian is extending the timeline for Marketplace revenue share rate increases to April 1, 2026. This change affects both Forge and Connect apps, allowing partners more time to adapt to evolving business models. The adjustments will support their transition from Data Center to cloud. Notably, Atlassian is also accelerating revenue share benefits, including a 100% revenue share discount for qualifying Forge apps starting January 1, 2026. This initiative aims to enhance partner support and…

item.title: [Live session] Agentic developer workflows powered by Rovo Dev
item.description: üöÄ Join us for a webinar on November 13th, 2025, focused on agentic developer workflows using Jira, Bitbucket, and Rovo Dev. Discover how Rovo Dev‚Äîour AI agent‚Äîcan enhance code generation, reviews, and overall production speed. The session will include demos, getting started tips, and a live Q&A with Atlassian experts. Don’t miss this opportunity to transform your workflows! üîó Sign up now! #Webinar #AI #DevTools #Atlassian #RovoDev

item.title: Never heard of restorative conflict resolution? Catch up quick
item.description: üõ†Ô∏è Restorative conflict resolution is gaining popularity in schools and workplaces. It focuses on repairing relationships rather than imposing punishments after conflicts. üó£Ô∏è This approach encourages open dialogue, allowing parties to understand each other‚Äôs perspectives and collaboratively find solutions. üîç It‚Äôs important to note that participation is voluntary, and accountability is emphasized through acknowledgment and responsibility for actions. #ConflictResolution #RestorativePractices…

item.title: Our Q1 FY26 letter to shareholders
item.description: üöÄ Atlassian reports a strong Q1 FY26 with total revenue reaching $1.4 billion, marking a 21% increase YoY. Cloud revenue surged to $998 million, a 26% rise YoY. AI adoption is growing rapidly, with over 3.5 million monthly active users. This is driving demand for our cloud services and strong migrations from Data Center to Cloud. We also announced the end of life for our Data Center offering, introducing ‚ÄòAtlassian Ascend‚Äô to support customer upgrades. #Atlassian #Q1FY26 #CloudComputing #AI…

The report details how modern work management solutions can boost agility and productivity. Check it out to learn more! üìä #Atlassian…

item.title: Manage your Pipelines usage with the new billing panel
item.description: üöÄ Exciting updates to the Pipelines Billing Panel! Users can now view pipeline minute usage by repository, not just the total for the workspace. This enhancement allows for better management of high-usage repositories across current and previous billing periods. To access, navigate to the Pipelines usage tab in workspace settings. Note: This feature is available only for monthly plan customers. #Atlassian #Pipelines #BillingPanel #WorkspaceManagement #TechUpdates

item.title: Start Your Engines: Codegeist 2025 Hackathon Is Here
item.description: üöÄ Codegeist 2025 is now open! This annual hackathon invites developers to create apps that enhance teamwork and collaboration, inspired by the precision of racing crews. Participants can use Forge to build solutions for Jira and Confluence. With over $120,000 in prizes available, including $15,000 for grand prize winners, there‚Äôs plenty to gain. The submission window runs from October 27 to December 22. Join the community and showcase your talent! üíªüèÜ #Codegeist2025 #Atlassian #Hackathon…

item.title: Make your Atlassian account safer (and easier to use!) with two-step verification
item.description: üîí Have you noticed an increase in email one-time passcodes (OTPs) when logging into your Atlassian account? This is part of Atlassian’s enhanced security measures to protect your account. Two-step verification (2SV) offers a more efficient way to secure your login. With 2SV, you‚Äôll use your password along with a second factor, like your phone, making it significantly harder for unauthorized access. üì± Setting up 2SV takes just a few minutes and reduces the need for email codes, allowing for a…

Explore the new features and the future of AI at Atlassian! #Atlassian #AI #Teamwork #Rovo #Innovation

item.title: Avoiding the broadcast trap: A simple ritual for effective adoption
item.description: üöÄ Effective AI adoption goes beyond just informing teams. Design company BUCK emphasizes the importance of hands-on experimentation over traditional training methods. Their findings reveal that active practice leads to better outcomes than passive learning. Creating ‚Äúpractice blocks‚Äù can foster this experimentation, allowing teams to test new workflows in low-stakes environments. Let‚Äôs rethink our approach to adopting new tools! #AIAdoption #TeamWork #Experimentation #Productivity…

item.title: Unlocking workflow flexibility with variable-sharing between parent and child pipelines
item.description: üöÄ Bitbucket Pipelines has introduced enhancements for the Parent/Child Pipelines feature! Users can now share variables from parent steps to child pipelines, improving workflow flexibility. This allows for efficient variable management within your YAML file. However, be cautious: this feature is not for sharing sensitive information due to security risks. For more details, check out the article! #Bitbucket #Pipelines #DevOps #Workflow #Atlassian

item.title: Building on top of Rovo Dev Serve mode: Rovo Dev in the IDE

The IDE integration allows developers to stay in their workflow, access context easily, and view changes seamlessly. Currently supported in Visual Studio Code and its forks. Learn more about Rovo Dev and how to get started!…

item.title: Table Enhancer‚Äôs Evolution: Elevating User Experience from Data Center to Cloud
item.description: üöÄ Exciting developments in Confluence! The article discusses the evolution of the Table Enhancer plugin, designed to improve user experience from Data Center to Cloud. Key features include sorting, total lines, and sticky rows/columns. As Atlassian shifted to Cloud, the plugin faced challenges, leading to a temporary solution that impacted user experience. An automation assistant has been developed to simplify migration for existing users, streamlining the process. With new bodied macro…

item.title: 5 skills teams need to thrive in the age of AI (and how to build them)
item.description: AI is transforming our work landscape rapidly. By 2030, it‚Äôs expected that only a third of tasks will be completed by humans. To adapt, teams need to develop key skills. üîë Here are the top 5 skills to invest in: 1. Critical Thinking: Analyze and verify AI outputs to reduce risks. 2. Creativity: Generate new ideas and connect concepts. These skills can help future-proof your work. üí° For practical tips on building these competencies, check out the full article. #FutureOfWork #AI…

item.title: The consulting industry‚Äôs human-powered renaissance
item.description: The consulting industry is undergoing significant changes due to AI integration. Traditional pyramid structures are being replaced by an “obelisk” model, emphasizing fewer layers and more efficient teamwork. Key roles now include AI facilitators, engagement architects, and client leaders, focusing on human skills like judgment and relationship-building. Firms are encouraged to adapt hiring practices for future-ready talent. Investing in hybrid training and encouraging collaboration around AI…

item.title: Announcing social enterprise discounts: Atlassian tools for social impact teams

Learn more about how Atlassian is empowering social impact teams! üí™‚ú® #SocialImpact…

item.title: Great managers meet uncertainty with curiosity and confidence
item.description: Great managers embrace uncertainty with curiosity and confidence, according to Mark C. Crowley. In his book, The Power of Employee Well-Being, he emphasizes that focusing on team emotions boosts productivity. Crowley notes that 70% of employee feelings relate to their managers. By navigating uncertain situations with curiosity, leaders can reduce stress for their teams. Curiosity is a key leadership skill; asking questions and seeking diverse perspectives leads to better decision-making and…

Say goodbye to siloed teams and clunky tools! #Atlassian #ServiceManagement #AI #Teamwork #Innovation

item.title: Announcing Atlas Camp: Amsterdam Call for Speakers
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! The call for speakers is now open for Atlas Camp 2026 in Amsterdam. This flagship Atlassian conference focuses on sharing real stories about platform extensibility, software delivery, and AI-powered solutions. Join a global community and inspire others! Submit your proposal at events.atlassian.com/atlascamp-cfs. #AtlasCamp #Developers #Atlassian #TechCommunity #CallForSpeakers

item.title: Runs on Atlassian Apps Can Now Take Home 100% of Marketplace Revenue
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news for developers! Atlassian has announced that partners with Runs on Atlassian apps can now retain 100% of their Marketplace revenue until they reach $1 million in lifetime Forge revenue. This incentive is effective immediately for qualifying apps, allowing for greater financial growth. For apps launched after this announcement, they can also qualify for this revenue share benefit. This initiative aims to support partners in delivering secure solutions and fostering innovation….

item.title: Announcing the new ‚ÄòGet the most out of Forge‚Äô learning path

This structured program includes step-by-step modules, hands-on labs, and quizzes to track progress. It’s perfect for new developers and those looking to enhance their skills. Get started today on Atlassian Learning! #Atlassian #Forge #AppDevelopment #LearningPath #Developers

item.title: From embedded to everywhere: The new era of apps
item.description: Atlassian is evolving the way we view its offerings. The term “products” like Jira and Confluence is changing to “Atlassian apps,” reflecting a new approach. These apps run on the Atlassian platform, which provides a robust infrastructure for all. This shift allows users to assemble a unique system of work, combining Atlassian-built apps, Marketplace apps, and custom solutions seamlessly. Developers can now create apps that connect across the platform, enhancing integration and user…

item.title: Why Jenkins might cost you 10x more than Bitbucket Pipelines
item.description: Running your own CI/CD with Jenkins can lead to significant costs. Many teams overlook the true expenses associated with under-provisioning resources or hiring a platform-engineering team. While Jenkins may seem cheaper, the total cost of ownership can be up to 10x higher than using services like Bitbucket Pipelines. CI/CD workloads vary throughout the day, creating challenges in scaling efficiently. Consider the implications of your CI/CD choice carefully. üíª‚öôÔ∏è #CICD #DevOps…

item.title: Less noise, more signal: Atlassian‚Äôs responsible AI journey continues
item.description: Atlassian is committed to responsible AI, ensuring that its tools align with customer needs and community values. These tools aim to help teams implement responsible AI practices effectively. This update reflects months of feedback and collaboration, focusing on key AI use cases and partnerships. item.title: DevMate: Accelerating React Native Development at Atlassian
item.description: At Atlassian, we understand that a seamless developer experience is crucial for productivity and team satisfaction. Our Mobile Platform team faced challenges during the migration of the Confluence Mobile app to React Native, including lengthy build times and complex environment setups. To address these issues, we developed DevMate, an in-house CLI tool that streamlines environment setup and significantly reduces build times. With DevMate, developers can set up their environments in minutes,…

item.title: [Open beta] Introducing Packages: native container registry in Bitbucket Cloud
item.description: üöÄ Bitbucket Packages is now in open beta for Standard and Premium workspaces! This feature offers a built-in container registry, allowing teams to manage artifacts seamlessly within Bitbucket Cloud. It supports container images and carries over user permissions for security. üîç The beta is free for now, but will transition to a paid model in December 2025. Monitor your usage to avoid unexpected costs later. Get ready for a unified code and artifact management experience! #Bitbucket #DevOps…

item.title: The Nonprofit AI Collaboration Index 2025
item.description: AI is increasingly becoming essential for nonprofit professionals. According to Atlassian’s 2025 Nonprofit AI Collaboration Index, while 99% believe in AI’s workplace potential, only 31% view it as a strategic partner. Those who do report a 29% boost in productivity. The report highlights the importance of advancing AI collaboration to enhance work quality and creativity. üìäü§ñ‚ú® #Nonprofits #AI #Productivity #Collaboration #WorkplaceInnovation

item.title: Good people management begins with self-understanding
item.description: Understanding yourself is key to effective people management. üß† Margaret Andrews emphasizes that strong managers must reflect on their own values, emotions, and influences. Her book, “Manage Yourself to Lead Others,” provides tools for self-assessment at any career stage. Start your journey with six key questions to enhance self-awareness. item.title: From pledges to practice: Atlassian‚Äôs commitments to the EU AI Pact and responsible AI governance
item.description: In September 2024, Atlassian participated in the launch of the EU AI Pact in Brussels, joining over 100 leaders in committing to responsible AI practices. ü§ù Our report, “From Pledges to Practice,” details our five key commitments aimed at ensuring compliance with the EU AI Act. item.title: How to minimize the impact of manager changes
item.description: üöÄ Manager changes can be challenging, but how they are handled makes a difference. Research shows that frequent changes can impact employee retention, especially with external hires. However, the focus should be on effective transition strategies rather than just frequency. Atlassian‚Äôs People Insights team found that clear communication and empathy can ease disruptions. Managers can take proactive steps to support their teams during these times. #Leadership #ManagerChange #TeamSupport…

item.title: Advice for first-time managers, from leaders who‚Äôve been there
item.description: üöÄ Stepping into a management role? Here are 29 valuable tips from experienced leaders to ease your transition. Setting boundaries and prioritizing self-care are also essential for effective leadership. üå± #FirstTimeManager #LeadershipTips #CareerGrowth #ManagementAdvice #SelfCare

item.title: Bitbucket Cloud enters phase two of app password deprecation
item.description: üö® Bitbucket Cloud is moving to Phase 2 of app password deprecation! Starting September 9, 2025, new app passwords will no longer be created. Existing passwords will remain valid until June 9, 2026. New integrations must use API tokens for enhanced security and control. Admins should start migrating their teams now to avoid disruptions. üîó Learn more about this transition! #Bitbucket #APITokens #Security #DeveloperTools #Atlassian

item.title: Behind the screens: Building Atlassian‚Äôs new icon system
item.description: üöÄ Atlassian is evolving its icon system to enhance user experience! After six years, the team recognized inconsistencies in size, style, and clarity across over 350 icons. This led to a redesign aimed at creating a cohesive, modern look that aligns with current UI standards. The new icons feature refined stroke widths and improved alignment, ensuring better visual harmony with the overall design. Stay tuned for more updates on this exciting transformation! #Atlassian #Design #UserExperience…

item.title: Ascend to the cloud: The next chapter for Atlassian and our customers
item.description: üöÄ Atlassian is embracing a cloud-first future! With 99% of its 300,000+ customers already on the cloud, the company is sunsetting Data Center products over the next three years. Many organizations report faster results and reduced costs through the cloud. Atlassian is committed to supporting all customers…

item.title: From Data Center to Cloud: The Next Chapter for Marketplace Apps
item.description: Atlassian announces the end of life for Data Center products, shifting to a cloud-first approach over the next three years. This transition aims to enhance innovation and agility for customers. Marketplace apps will also gradually be phased out, with key dates set for app submissions and renewals. A new license option for Bitbucket Data Center apps will allow more flexibility during this change. Atlassian is committed to supporting customers and partners throughout this journey. #Atlassian…

item.title: Welcoming The Browser Company to Atlassian
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news from Atlassian! We are welcoming The Browser Company, creators of the Dia and Arc browsers, into the Atlassian family. With an emphasis on security and usability, it aims to redefine how we work online. Looking forward to…

item.title: Atlassian Research: What Do Developers Think About Code Readability in the Age of LLMs?
item.description: Atlassian’s research explores the importance of code readability in the era of Large Language Models (LLMs) like RovoDev. Key findings show that 81% of developers still view code readability as essential, primarily for reducing maintenance costs. Despite LLMs writing more code, many practitioners are open to using these tools to enhance readability. The study emphasizes that readable code remains crucial for effective collaboration. #CodeReadability #LLMs #SoftwareDevelopment #Atlassian…

item.title: The State of Product in 2026: Navigating Change, Challenge, and Opportunity
item.description: Product work is evolving, becoming more complex and crucial. A recent article reveals insights from product teams in the U.S., France, and Germany. Most professionals feel empowered, with 85% having a strategic role. However, they face pressure to deliver results, with 84% fearing product failure. Challenges include limited time for planning and data analysis, leading to uninformed decisions. Collaboration often suffers as 80% of teams don‚Äôt involve engineers early on. AI tools are used…

item.title: Cycle is joining Atlassian
item.description: üöÄ Exciting news! Cycle is joining Atlassian to enhance Jira Product Discovery with AI-powered feedback capabilities. This integration will help product managers capture and process customer insights directly within Jira, streamlining decision-making and improving alignment across teams. Cycle will simplify feedback management by automatically gathering insights and highlighting key information, enabling more confident product development. item.title: 1 Billion Build Minutes Later: How we reinvented CI/CD at Atlassian

item.title: From contextual understanding to execution: AI that truly works as part of your team

item.title: Improving Coding Agent Experience
item.description: Atlassian is enhancing the coding agent experience through machine learning. This aims to identify well-scoped Jira work items and provide relevant code context, leading to more efficient AI-powered development for software teams. Key indicators of effective task descriptions include detailed descriptions, presence of file paths, code snippets, and technical terms. These elements help coding agents understand and act on tasks more effectively. For implementation, Atlassian is considering both…

item.title: Comment ranker ‚Äì An ML-based classifier to improve LLM code review quality using Atlassian‚Äôs proprietary data
item.description: Atlassian has introduced an ML-based comment ranker to enhance code review quality using proprietary data. This tool, part of the Rovo Dev agents, helps developers by filtering comments generated by LLMs, significantly improving efficiency. In its open beta, it has already supported over 43K PRs monthly and reduced PR cycle time by 30%. The comment ranker optimizes comment selection based on success metrics, ensuring only valuable feedback is highlighted for developers. #Atlassian #CodeReview…

item.title: Atlassian‚Äôs AI Gateway: Best in Class Model Garden
item.description: üöÄ Atlassian has launched its AI Gateway, a solution designed to streamline access to various LLMs from top providers like OpenAI and Google. This platform supports developers by offering a curated model garden with over 20 LLMs and integrates seamlessly with existing tools. It features a unified API for easy model switching and automated fallback options for reliability. All models maintain zero data retention, ensuring user privacy and security. #Atlassian #AI #MachineLearning #LLM…

item.title: To Bitbucket from Jenkins: Enhancing Developer Experience
item.description: Atlassian’s latest article discusses the advantages of transitioning from Jenkins to Bitbucket Cloud with Bitbucket Pipelines for CI/CD. The 2025 State of DevEx report reveals that 50% of developers lose over 10 hours weekly due to inefficiencies, and only 16% of their time is spent on coding. This highlights the need for better tools to enhance developer experience. The article also outlines the setup process for Jenkins, emphasizing the complexities involved. #DevExperience #Bitbucket…

item.title: AI needs human partners to elevate its work ‚Äì and keep it in check
